data.title: Latest update breaks cursorEnd and cursorHome shortcuts

milestone.title: Backlog
milestone.description: Work not yet planned for a specific release.

data.body:
<!-- Use Help > Report Issues to prefill these. -->
- VSCode Version: 1.15.1 (commit 41abd21afdf7424c89319ee7cb0445cc6f376959)
- OS Version: macOS Sierra (10.12.6)

Steps to Reproduce:

1. Type several lines of text, eg:
```
Lorem ipsum dolor sit amet, consectetur adipiscing elit, sed do eiusmod tempor incididunt ut labore et dolore magna aliqua. 
Ut enim ad minim veniam, quis nostrud exercitation ullamco laboris nisi ut aliquip ex ea commodo consequat. 
Duis aute irure dolor in reprehenderit in voluptate velit esse cillum dolore eu fugiat nulla pariatur. 
Excepteur sint occaecat cupidatat non proident, sunt in culpa qui officia deserunt mollit anim id est laborum.
```
2. Place cursor randomly inside that text
3. Try to select until the end/beginning of the line, respectively using <kbd>⌘</kbd><kbd>⇧</kbd><kbd>←</kbd> and <kbd>⌘</kbd><kbd>⇧</kbd><kbd>→</kbd>

In my case, no selection happens. And trying to edit the keyboard shortcut for `cursorEnd` does not seem to respond to the combination <kbd>⌘</kbd><kbd>→</kbd> at all (same for `cursorEndSelect`, `cursorHome` etc).

<!-- Launch with `code --disable-extensions` to check. -->
Reproduces without extensions: Yes

data.title: Adding to the activity bar from extensions
data.body:
Can anyone (please please) explain why addidng to the activity bar from extensions was removed from the ui please  ? according to [this](https://github.com/Microsoft/vscode-extension-samples/blob/master/tree-view-sample/USAGE.md) it is still supported.

I am just trying to understand the reasoning here. To me this feels like a very narrow way of extending the platform and i find it very restrictive for unnecessary reasons.

Thank you

data.title: Wrong keyboard shortcuts
Hide tabs section entirely
data.body:
<!-- Do you have a question? Please ask it on http://stackoverflow.com/questions/tagged/vscode. -->

<!-- Use Help > Report Issues to prefill these. -->
- VSCode Version: 1.15.0
- OS Version: Manjaro Linux x64 Gellivara

Steps to Reproduce:

1. Configure `settings.json`

```
{
  "workbench.editor.showTabs": false
}
```

2. Tabs are hidden but tabs section still fill the space.

Reproduces without extensions: Yes

Some captures:

1. Face to face with Vim

![screenshot_20170831_111904](https://user-images.githubusercontent.com/3067335/29933705-34de99d4-8e3e-11e7-81aa-2a01efef8049.png)

2. Proposed setting:

```
{
  "workbench.editor.showTabs": "none | one | all"
}
```

With `"workbench.editor.showTabs": "none"` then

![screenshot_20170831_112820](https://user-images.githubusercontent.com/3067335/29934088-8081d7c4-8e3f-11e7-8654-c36488789f65.png)

data.title: Fallback not working on invalid shell
data.body:
Verifying #21635 

1.16-insiders
Windows 64
- create a Node app `app.js`
- create a launch config that uses the integratedTerminal as console:
```
{
    "version": "0.2.0",
    "configurations": [
        {
            "type": "node",
            "request": "launch",
            "name": "Launch Program",
            "program": "${workspaceRoot}/app.js",
            "console": "integratedTerminal"
        }
    ]
}
```
- in the user settings, have `"terminal.integrated.shell.windows": "powershell.exe`
- launch the programm. Programm starts, output in integrated powershell terminal
- in the user settings, change to `"terminal.integrated.shell.windows": "powershell.exe1`
- launch the programm. Programm doesn't want to start. Error 'Cannot connect to runtime with 'legacy' protocol...
https://github.com/Microsoft/vscode/issues/21635#issuecomment-325320392 ays it would fallback to cmd.exe

data.title: Prompting for user permission, but console is run
data.body:
verifying #21635
1.16-insiders
Ubuntu 14.04 & Windows 64
- create a Node app `app.js`
- create a launch config that uses the integratedTerminal as console:
```
{
    "version": "0.2.0",
    "configurations": [
        {
            "type": "node",
            "request": "launch",
            "name": "Launch Program",
            "program": "${workspaceRoot}/app.js",
            "console": "integratedTerminal"
        }
    ]
}
```
- in the workspace settings, have `"terminal.integrated.shell.linux": "/bin/zsh"`
- launch the programm
- dialog pops up 'Do you allow shell: "/bin/zsh" (defined as a workspace setting) to be launched in the terminal?'
- observe that the shell is started and the programm is launched without waiting for the user to allow or disallow.

- Extensions: 

Extension|Author (truncated)|Version
---|---|---

gitlens|eam|4.4.3
EditorConfig|Edi|0.9.4
prettier-vscode|esb|0.23.1
beautify|Hoo|1.1.1

vscode-jumpy|wma|0.3.1

---

`justify-items` and `justify-self` are commonly used properties in CSS Grids, which are now supported by all major web browsers. 

See: https://www.w3.org/TR/css-grid-1/#row-align

data.title: filters in emmet.syntaxProfiles is not honored
data.body:
According to https://docs.emmet.io/customization/syntax-profiles/#create-your-own-profile, filters in emmet.syntaxProfiles are the default set of filters to be applied

This doesn't work in Emmet 2.0

data.title: Automatically trigger a powershell script when open a new terminal
data.body: Everytime when I open a new terminal in vscode (v1.13.1), I have to manually trigger a script which is written to set up some environment path for the session. Is it possible to configure vscode such that whenever a terminal is newly opened, it will auto trigger a script which is located at say "C:\myScript.ps"?

data.title: How to view list function
data.body:
<!-- Do you have a question? Please ask it on http://stackoverflow.com/questions/tagged/vscode. -->

<!-- Use Help > Report Issues to prefill these. -->
- VSCode Version: 
- OS Version: Windows 7

Questions: I am very like to use this app to develop app with C language. It almost the best app which I have developed before(Sakura editor, Hidemaru editor). 
But, It's has a big problem which I can"t manage my project when my project have more than 50 functions at the same files. In Sakura editor or Hidemaru, I easy to sea list functions at each file that I had opened. This list functions was auto list at the left panel... So convenient.

Realy, I want to use Visual Studio Code, Because It's have a Intelegent, Easy to load folders  in Visual Studio Code....

Please ! Please add the panel which auto list function of file when I open that file.

Wait your response!!!!!! Thanks team for the best App.

data.title: have an extension with user interface?
data.body:
Google chrome extensions can have custom UI built with HTML/CSS/JAVASCRIPT.
Could vscode have the same ability?
And the extensions should able to communicate with main VS code to modify user's code.

Here's I want to do in extension:
When user right click a folder on explorer, show an custom menu  item, then user click a item "import template". pop out a dialog which shows a list of template(html, js) then user select a template to import the template code into that folder.

data.title: SCM: Can't open a file in scm viewlet when viewlet is being refreshed
data.body:
Similar to #30323

Since the list handles clicks as:

- on mouse down, it sets focus
- on mouse up, it sets selection and opens the file

If the list gets refreshed between mouse down and mouse up, the click won't do anything. This is very noticeable since the scm viewlet refreshes A LOT.

data.body: This broke it: https://github.com/Microsoft/vscode/commit/062d65d175fb2183950cd1b02652799ae776c7c3

data.title: Feature request: auto_id_class

milestone.title: Backlog
milestone.description: Work not yet planned for a specific release.

data.body:
![68747470733a2f2f6769746875622e636f6d2f627261646c6579666c6f6f642f6175746f2d69642d636c6173732f626c6f622f6d61737465722f73637265656e2d7265636f7264696e672d64656d6f2e6769663f7261773d74727565](https://user-images.githubusercontent.com/645641/29925253-ff01d9c6-8e5f-11e7-83f5-af10a151de8a.gif)


Sublime Text has a nice option, not very well known I guess: `auto_id_class: true`. It allows, when focus is in a HTML tag, to type `#` to write `id=""`, and `.` to write `class=""`. Simple but very useful. I found an [extension for Atom](https://atom.io/packages/auto-id-class), but nothing for VScode. 

Did anyone find something similar?

data.title: Option to allow quickSuggestions inside words
data.body:
quickSuggestions do not show up when typing in the middle of a word.
It would be great if that could be configured by the language (or even the user).

Languages with completion proposals that do not only insert but also replace the end of the symbol, can then enable this setting.

data.title: azure-account extension is missing licenses
data.body:
I was running the [OSS tool](https://github.com/Microsoft/vscode-distro/blob/master/distro-tools/README.md) today and it found several issues:

- do not add devDependencies to the npm-shrinkwrap.json. I've already removed them.

- the OSS tool reported these errors:
ERROR: aws-sign2@0.6.0: Missing Copyright statement in license text!
ERROR: azure-arm-resource@2.0.0-preview: Missing Copyright statement in license text!
ERROR: bcrypt-pbkdf@1.0.1: No license detail found at repositoryURL: null
ERROR: caseless@0.12.0: Missing Copyright statement in license text!
ERROR: copy-paste@1.3.0: Missing Copyright statement in license text!
ERROR: forever-agent@0.6.1: Missing Copyright statement in license text!
ERROR: json-schema@0.2.3: No license detail found at repositoryURL: https://github.com/kriszyp/json-schema
ERROR: jsonify@0.0.0: No license detail found at repositoryURL: https://github.com/substack/jsonify
ERROR: ms-rest-azure@2.2.3: Missing Copyright statement in license text!
ERROR: ms-rest@2.2.1: Missing Copyright statement in license text!
ERROR: oauth-sign@0.8.2: Missing Copyright statement in license text!
ERROR: tunnel-agent@0.6.0: Missing Copyright statement in license text!
ERROR: tweetnacl@0.14.5: Missing Copyright statement in license text!
ERROR: windows-process-tree@0.1.3: No license detail found at repositoryURL: null
ERROR: xmldom@0.1.27: Missing Copyright statement in license text!
ERROR: xpath.js@1.0.7: Missing Copyright statement in license text!

As an example we've already added an Apache license for the "request" npm module.

data.title: SCM view is not refreshing list of changes until 'Refresh' button is clicked
data.body:
<!-- Do you have a question? Please ask it on http://stackoverflow.com/questions/tagged/vscode. -->

<!-- Use Help > Report Issues to prefill these. -->
- VSCode Version: 1.16-insider d30825
- OS Version: Win10

Steps to Reproduce:

1. Change a file tracked by git
2. Open SCM view
3. The file doesn't appear in the list, nor does the SCM's info label update it's count: 
![image](https://user-images.githubusercontent.com/760112/29920391-f3e232ba-8e6a-11e7-984f-0d9be2abf3e6.png)
4. Click the 'Refresh' button in the SCM action bar: 
![image](https://user-images.githubusercontent.com/760112/29920373-de2623fa-8e6a-11e7-94f5-f2eff12309ba.png)
5. The file shows up in the changes list and the count label updates.

data.title: Tabs setting in .editorconfig not used for new file - have to reopen file before it work
data.body:
- VSCode Version: Code 1.15.1 (41abd21afdf7424c89319ee7cb0445cc6f376959, 2017-08-16T18:05:38.342Z)
- OS Version: Windows_NT ia32 10.0.15063
- Extensions: 

Extension|Author (truncated)|Version
---|---|---
vscode-eslint|dba|1.2.11
gitlens|eam|4.4.3
csharp|ms-|1.12.1
PowerShell|ms-|1.4.1
debugger-for-chrome|msj|3.2.0
material-icon-theme|PKi|2.2.0
vscode-icons|rob|7.12.0

(1 theme extensions excluded)


---

Steps to Reproduce:

1. Have an .editorconfig somewhere in the file system where the "indent_style = tab" setting is.
2. Right-click in the explorer-pane to create a new .js file
3. When you click "tab" spaces are inserted and not tabs as expected from the .editorconfig
4. Close the file and open gain. NOW it works correctly.

<!-- Launch with `code --disable-extensions` to check. -->
Reproduces without extensions: No. Even after reloading the file the indent_style setting of .editorconfig file is NOT used. Maybe the support for .editorconfig comes from one of the extensions?

data.title: SCM doesn't remove itself after removing workspace folder
data.body:
* Have a workspace with 2 folders, 1 under git, 1 not
* Add a third folder which is under git
* Remove that folder again
* The SCM viewlet still shows that folder
